title: Glasgow's Lord Provost apologises for spending £8,000 on clothes and shoes but defies resignation calls
text:
Glasgow's Lord Provost has tried to allay calls for her resignation by issuing a grovelling apology for charging the taxpayer £8,000 for clothes and shoes.

Eva Bolander, an SNP councillor, said she would repay some of the money she spent on items that included 23 pairs of shoes, six jackets, five coats, underwear and a £200 designer hat.

In an email to Glasgow councillors, she defended the claims by arguing they were "made in good faith" and each was "within the rules".

However, she admitted that "on reflection", she should not have submitted expense claims for some items and she is in discussions with the council over "an arrangement to repay the relevant expenditure."

Opposition parties welcomed...
description: Glasgow's Lord Provost has tried to allay calls for her resignation by issuing a grovelling apology for charging the taxpayer £8,000 for clothes and shoes.
